text: we were just talking about this earlier
this past weekend this weekend was the
10-year anniversary of Breaking Bad
premiering obviously all that then
leading to better call Saul you've now
been you've spent you're currently
shooting living in Albuquerque tell me
about the journey for you and how you
sum up the past several years almost
almost decade a complete surprise you
know to be invited to be a part of
Breaking Bad in the end of the second
season so I've been going to Albuquerque
for nine years but when it all started
Breaking Bad was not a big hit right and
it was an uncertain project even in the
second and third season and so I didn't
know if we'd continue it was a great job
to have and a challenge and something
really fresh for me because I come from
comedy that was my whole career really
up to Breaking Bad and so it just was
one continual surprise after another for
the big success of Breaking Bad and the
suggestion to even do better call Saul
which just came out of nowhere and then
Vince Gilligan who created Breaking Bad
and Peter Gould who wrote the show that
had Saul in it the episode started
ganging up and the idea of a show about
Saul but it never it was just never a
sure thing until now we're in our fourth
season we're shooting now it feels like
a real thing that's happening the real
thing and we've been really happy to
have you here with us you'll have fun on
that red carpet we'll be watching
[Music]
